intro: Lachenalia barkeriana, commonly known as the Barker's lachenalia, is a species of flowering plant in the Amaryllidaceae family. It is native to South Africa, specifically the Western Cape province, where it grows in rocky, well-drained soils. The plant produces showy, bell-shaped flowers in shades of yellow and orange during the summer months. It is characterized by its rosette-forming leaves and is often cultivated for its ornamental value. Due to its specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
